reviews.review_msg: Sherryl is a decent professor, however she does get far behind on lecture material somehow even though she just reads directly off the slides. Quizzes and exams are purely online which makes little sense and result in ridiculously high averages. Content can be a bit dry, but ultimately it is an interesting course and she is very nice.

3 online exams, tutorial and complicated all MC quizzes. Exams were ok but she made 3 Q's from one specific slide. a lot of useless stuff was gone over in lectures ( tissue movement) that did not show up on exam. Shes nice tho and you can get a good mark if you can understand results of experiments. Tests very specific and wants key words

As a prof shes great. reads off slides but slides have good diagrams and everything you need to know. This class just makes you use your brain too much lol. No point in memorizing anything and there's 3 exams all online and you have enough time to do em. Quizzes are complicated and i wish she would give more time for them. Material+ concepts are ok

Super nice, knowledgable, and accommodating. Questions were encouraged and met with thoughtful and kind answers. Provides comprehensive and well-organized slides (that are posted online) and engaging lectures, and exams were take-home, open-book, and fair. Would recommend a course with her to anyone!

She was a very nice and accommodating prof! The exam was open book and critical thinking but everything is from the slides. Slides are really text heavy and she mostly just reads off the slides during class but she sometimes adds more details so it's still okay to attend. The algae paper guidelines were unclear so hope she fixes that in the future.
Very kind and knowledgeable. Slides are filled out and easy to follow with important information. Testing very fair but her 1 hour presentations are kind of annoying. Highly recommend, though.

Sherryl is super nice and genuinely loves teaching, especially about algae. Her lectures are straight forward and to the point, with all the info you need to succeed in her slides. Her exams are take home and are focused on applying your knowledge from the course to different situations. Lab portion (not Sherryl) felt miss-matched to the lecture

Dr Bisgrove is a great prof. Material can appear complicated at times, but is overall straight forward and explained well by Dr Bisgrove. Quizzes were a little rushed and complicated for the time given. Exams were tedious but doable and straight forward. Can be a little picky with marks, so dont leave out details and explain your reasonings

Despite the difficulties of teaching BISC 326 online, Sherryl did an amazing job. Labs consisted of assignments that required you to look info up online to answer questions. It was really straightforward and easy to do well in. Final was take-home and we had 4 days to write it. Definitely try this course with Sherryl!

Sherryl was such an amazing prof. 333 is a very content heavy course and there is A LOT to know. Gives short answer questions for exams ahead of time, although avgs were still in the 60's for exams because marking was super particular. Pretty hard class, but Sherryl does her best to make it easier. Wouldn't take this class with anyone else
Sherryl was fantastic! It is clear she cares very much for both the course topic and her students. Algae exam was more than fair!

Sherryl is an absolutely lovely professor that does an amazing job of facilitating a great learning environment. However, her lectures are disorganized and her exam questions are all theory and critical thinking, so be prepared to think about the big ideas and not memorization. Ask her questions!! She will answer them. :)

I would suggest taking Developmental Biology with Sherryl because she doesn't emphasize memorization. Instead, her exams are experimental questions that require critical thinking. I think this is the best way to learn in comparison to straight up memorizing everything. 3 exams + 10% tutorial marks. I got a B+ with a decent amount of effort.
Super super nice. Lectures are disorganized but heavy emphasis on critical thinking and problem-solving is good. Overall good prof

Sherryl is probably one of the friendliest professors I have ever had SFU. She really wants to help you understand the subject and always is available for help. Extremely approachable, and very helpful. Her tests are fair and overall, just a really good prof. If you can take a class with her, then do it!

Dr. Bisgrove is a super-nice professor. Tests can be difficult, but developmental biology is not an easy topic. She really tests your understanding of underlying scientific principles with thoughtful questions, as opposed to rote memorization of facts that you will just forget in 6 months. The harder exam questions are given out a day in advance.
Sherryl was very helpful moving my project forward. Definitely she is the best professor I've ever met. I strongly suggest to take any course with her. I bet you all will love her.
Really friendly and approachable prof. Would automatically come up and ask you if you have any questions. Lecture material was really boring but she tries her best to teach them enthusiastically.

Sherryl is a great prof! She's super approachable and very helpful. Textbook is not necessary at all as she always puts all necessary info on the slides. Tests can be a little tricky because they require you to think more, not just memorize stuff. One of my favourite profs at SFU so far.

Sherryl taught the algae portion of BISC 326 and I have to say that she was a great professor. Her interest in the material is high, as is her knowledge on the concepts. She was very approachable and very helpful when students needed any clarification. Overall, she has been one of my favorite's at SFU. Would DEFINITELY take another course with her!
Sherryl had a great attitude toward her students and was extremely approachable. She makes sure you understand the concepts and tested fairly.

No need to buy text, since class notes are all that is testable, and they are pulled from the text anyways. Exams were very difficult, since several questions were completely incomprehensible (many people complained). Rarely able to answer questions asked in class- this is a current topics course, but doesn't seem to keep on top of research.

A nice, friendly lady. Explains the concepts well and expects you to apply the concepts on exams. It was an interesting class and she incorporated many videos and pictures to allow you to visualize what was occurring in the embryos.

This was her first time teaching Developmental Biology, and I thought she did a really good job. She usually deals with plants and fungi, so animals were a little out of her field, but she made sure we understood the concepts, and tried to get us to think about the models, rather than just having us memorize things.  Also had a great attitude :)

Great prof. Keeps course content interesting by drawing from recent clinical implications or health-related topics. Sometimes the content can be a bit dry, but that's just the nature of the subject. Her exams are very fair and she makes sure that the grading is treated farily.

Her marking scheme is quite fair for mbb 231. Here is the mark breakdown 30%midterm 1, 30% midterm 2, and 30% final, and 10% tutorial. She is really helpful and her exams are based on her lecture notes. I definitely recommend another class with Dr Bisgrove because I got a B- in this class which I had to repeat.
Sheryl's great - a lot of fun, very friendly and has a lot of enthusiasm. Lectures were good, midterm was very reasonable. Recommend the proff and the course.

Never take her course, at least her MBB221!!!She is boring and her notes are pointless. She just pastes the whole text into her powerpoint with adding useless information and deleting imprtant details, which makes the note even make less sense. Even when I did some preview, she could mess me up in her lecture, so I had to study again all by myself.
